inn1.comm: good start. Good length outside off, 135 kph. A hint of away movement, nothing prodigious. Tapped towards point

unplayable! Guptill could do nothing about that. A quick bowler's delight. Fuller than a good length - quite the ideal length. Guptill prods, played the line, didn't account for swing. Umesh got it to move away just enough, like the previous delivery, to beat Guptill's outside edge. Clatters into off stump. Not sure if that was bad batting or just sensational bowling. He did see a bit of swing off the previous delivery. Anyway, Guptill has failed again.
fullish on middle and off, Williamson shuffles across and pushes to mid-on
beauty! Lovely length, invites some swing with a full, wide delivery. The ball moves away prodigiously and beats the bat of Williamson as he looks to drive
good length outside off, still getting that outswing. A thick outside edge to third man

superb from Latham. 143 kph, fullish and wide outside off. Not that much swing, seemed like his footwork was a bit late to the ball. But he got his hands through it and drove past cover. Not over-hit, just timed. Like he did in the previous match.
poor ball with this field. Good length on off, 135 kph. The ball comes back in, Williamson walks across and flicks through the vacant square leg region for two. It's a 7-2 field
full and wide outside off, still some inswing. But he pushes the line much wider. Williamson leaves.
still a bit of inswing, definitely no outswing like in Dharamsala. Slightly wide-ish outside off, blocked.
135 kph, these are good lines. Good length outside off, WIlliamson's feet are nowhere. He stays back, but it isn't short. Isn't full either. Looks to punch from the crease but the ball goes past
goes full this time, on off or just outside off. Driven to mid-on
good finish. 140 kph, keeping it very close to off. Williamson shuffles across and looks to find a flick through the leg side, but nothing is there, so he pushes to mid-on
well bowled, full on a sixth-stump line. Gets this to move back in but Latham leaves. A good leave
brings this straighter. Full. To be fair, Latham shouldn't have been surprised by the direction of swing. He almost plays around his front pad and squeezes a run down to fine leg
I like that from Williamson. Shuffles across, brings Umesh straighter but he over-adjusts. Goes down leg and a free run
awesome! Just simple Test-match technique. Shuffled across or stood on middle. Umesh bowls this full on leg, simple enough for a class batsman to flick through midwicket. Great batting
good adjustment. Full outside off, not a lot of swing. Williamson drives to mid-off from the crease
140 kph, full on off. Definitely no swing. But it is naggingly accurate and so Williamson defends, head over the ball
good end from Umesh. Good length on off, or just fuller than a good length. Williamson keeps it out
'whoas' from the crowd. The first short length delivery today. Back of a length outside off, moves away. Left alone, Latham sways out of the line.
quite full on off, not much movement. Staunch defense from Latham
fullish on middle and leg, worked into the gap at midwicket for one
great technique from Williamson. Fuller length outside off, Williamson lets the ball come to him before dabbing it towards point with a defensive push.
and that's a good run. Full on off, or just outside. Williamson nudges towards wide mid-on
excellent end. Full on off, no room. Latham can do nothing but defend
again exemplary technique. Lets the outswinger swing, keeps his head close to the ball and dabs the ball to gully.
excellent lines. Great contest. A stump or two outside off, Williamson defends. Offering nothing full and wide
and again. Close to off on a full length. Decent pace. Blocked. Quality from both parties

not too straight, but a tad too full to this man. Goes towards off and middle this time and WIlliamson clips towards square leg. A dive from Jadhav to prevent the ball from going through, a laboured dive
140 kph, full outside off, some inswing. Pushed with the angle of swing to mid-on

nicely played. Two of NZ's best batsmen, technique wise, at the crease. And it shows. A short delivery on off, doesn't rise up much. Signs of a slowish surface. Latham gets on top of the bounce, and pulls through midwicket. Rolled his wrists on that
a productive run-scoring area has been shut out by that gully fielder. Good length outside off, dabbed to gully.
too full, too wide. A ball that deserved to go, but Williamson misses his drive. Wide called
fullish length on off, 142 kph. No room, worked to midwicket. Perfect area to Williamson
another gorgeous drive. Overpitched outside off, too wide. Williamson caresses his drive through cover. Not overhit, just perfect. Found the gap
good comeback from Pandya. Good length on off, defended
back of a length on off, good lines. Williamson tries to work the ball through midwicket, but it's too wide to clip. Gets it to mid-on
great end. Full outside off, Williamson strides forward and defends to mid-off.
overly full, overly wide. Latham thinks of going after it, bails out late. Wide called

dropped. Full and straight, Latham presents the full face of the bat and drives the ball back to Umesh's left. He gets his hand on it, but had no realistic chance of catching that, unless it stuck. It didn't
full and wide outside off, defended

oh superb shot! Another gem of a drive. Overpitched outside off, Latham plants his front foot forward and just times his cover drive past cover. Shot of the day. Not much of a follow-through either. Superlative timing
drags his length back - on middle and off. Defended
that's a clever variation, and a lovely length to try that. A slower ball, full and wide outside off. Asks Latham to drive uppishly but he leaves
four more! Runs conceding easily. Strays down leg, easy pickings for Latham who just gets some bat on that, to help it down to the fine leg boundary. Really good batting

another free boundary. Pandya goes wide of the crease, good length on middle. A bad ball to Williamson, who is standing on middle, so you have to be wider. Williamson clips it to the fine leg boundary. Out if he missed, but he didn't
too full, overpitched outside off. Williamson delectably drives to extra cover who half-stops the ball. Williamson has found his timing, both these batsmen have
139 kph, full on off and middle. Defended
quite full and wide outside off, solidly over the ball to keep it out
136 kph, good length outside off. No swing. Good lines and so Latham respectfully defends
fullish and wide outside off, another good leave. Pulled that over back, but still productive for NZ
good length outside off, 136 kph. Pushed back. Nice length that
it ain't easy to pierce the packed off side field. Even if it short and wide like this. Williamson cuts straight to extra cover
good length outside off, 138 kph. Impeccable line that. Nothing even a batsman like Williamson can do, tries to muscle it straight, Instead, pushes to mid-on
just wide of square leg. A 6-3 field in fact. Shortish on off, WIlliamson pulls, doesn't keep it down and somehow finds the gap past square leg. Not a shot he was in complete control of.
a wry smile from Bumrah. hardly got up. Good length outside off, keeps excessively low. Goes underneath Williamson's bat. Put it out of your mind and move on
full and straight, defended to mid-on. The best over of the day, in terms of lines
another really good shot, met by an equally good stop. Shortish and wide outside off, Latham cuts nicely to point. Extra cover gets across and sticks out his right hand to stop the boundary
an iffy stroke, atypically loose, good length outside off. Williamson flirts with it, but the ball doesn't kiss his outside edge. Beaten
good length outside off, steered to gully. Good captaincy from Dhoni, important to know your opposition
bad ball. Short and wide outside off, 137 kph. Terrible delivery. Williamson looks to cut, but gets a thick outside edge which flies past Dhoni for four. Didn't attempt the catch. No chance for MS
full outside off, driven to mid-off
another beautiful shot, good length outside off, steered past backward point. A couple.
tossed up outside off, 82 ks. But good loop. Flicked to deep midwicket
good length, flat on off. A hint of spin. Williamson stays back and pushes back
good use of the feet, gets to the pitch and blocks back. Nice pace from Axar
fired in on off and middle, Williamson stays back and pushes back. Good contest this
slow through the air, but short still. Flat. Williamson stays back and punches to mid-on
Williamson comes down and flicks to deep square leg. Straight from Axar. Almost, across the line. Bumrah is quick to it, but returns a poor throw and the second is completed easily
full and straight, 141 kph. Pushed back. Bumrah's lines have been exceptionally good today
141 kph, a tad straight and worked away through midwicket
a half-volley outside off, Williamson tries to steer the ball past gully but finds him
quite full again outside off, Williamson steers the ball towards point. Not given anything to score of by Bumrah
and immediately Williamson opens the face of his bat and steers down to third man.
slower delivery to end, Latham defends from the front foot
creamed through midwicket for four. Great shot. Flat on off, Williamson gets low and swats the ball through midwicket. Picked the length extremely early
nicely tossed up outside off, better line. Pushed away towards point
six! Knew exactly what he wanted all along. Runs to the pitch of the ball, gets there and lofts the ball over mid-on. Classy batting.
oh clever. Knew Axar will compensate with a flat delivery, so WIlliamson stays back and steers the ball past gully. Let the ball come to him and then used Axar's pace. All class
flat on off, pushed to long-off. Great batting
flat on off, simple enough for Latham to go back and work the ball to deep square leg
a tad too full outside off from Bumrah, Latham opens the face of his bat to get his drive in the gap at sweeper cover

very very close that! Loud appeal, but umpire Oxenford says no. Bumrah's angle from wide of the crease hits Williamson on the pad in front of middle and leg. Just missed his flick there. Sliding down probably.
good length outside off, steered down towards point
nice from Bumrah. Full and straight on off, Williamson is eager, but has to defend

did that carry? Pandya the man. Did not look like he went to the ball, but went slightly horizontally. It carried. Full outside off, Williamson looked to go over the infield but mis-hit that badly. Pandya at mid-off got down, but dropped it. Made a tough chance tougher with his footwork

superb shot. Overpitched outside off from Bumrah, inviting Latham onto the front foot, and like he has done in this series, found the gap with an exquisitely-timed cover drive berween cover and mid-off.
poor ball. And Williamson gets to fifty. What an innings this has been. Flat down leg, and Williamson sweeps powerfully, hit the ball intentionally in the gap at backward square leg
slow on off, a bit of flight. Good delivery, defended

Williamson makes the shot by stepping out, getting to the flight, converting it into a full toss and then flicking the ball in the gap through wide mid-on. Just awesome batting. Dhoni and Mishra have a chat
tossed up outside off, Williamson gets forward and blocks
good end. "Bahut badiya, Mish," says Dhoni (Very good). Loopy delivery outside off, not much spin. Williamson defends
flat down leg from around the wicket, clipped to square leg.
flat delivery on middle, no straight. Pushed back
inside edge onto the pad. Flat delivery on middle and leg, Williamson hits that into his pad. A vociferous appeal is turned down
flat delivery on middle, punched to long-on
a shot he has been playing very well on the tour. Gets low and nails his conventional sweep, towards backward square leg. Rahane rushes across and saves the boundary with a superb dive
lands just in front! Flat delivery on middle and leg, Latham gets a top edge this time and it lands in front of Rahane at backward square leg
flat from Mishra outside off, pushed to cover from the back foot
swept for six! Gets low, knows where he wants to hit it. And then hammers his sweep over the boundary at deep square leg.
flatter outside off, pushed close to cover. Both respond to the run and it's completed
great batting, tossed up on off, Williamson gets down and pushes to long-on
flatter again outside off, punched to cover again. Went deep in the crease
87 kph, staying on the back foot. Mishra fires this one in doesn't get much spin. Hit to long-on
from quite deep in the crease, slow on off. Short, Latham goes back and punches with ease to long-on
flat and wide outside off, Williamson cuts to point. Chooses to stay on the back foot
tossed up outside off, comes down this time and swishes his drive to cover
good pace. Flat on off, worked towards square leg. Good line too. Williamson came down, but didn't get there
another slider outside off, blocked from deep in the crease
lots of flight outside off, pushed to long-on. Got onto the front foot this time. These two doing it nicely
the googly on leg. Latham gets a leading edge to midwicket. Looked to nudge that towards square leg
another googly, good variation. Tossed up on off, defended. Watchfully
feigned a forward movement, wanted to come down but couldn't because of the flat length. Improvises a tap towards point
another sweep. Flat outside off, Latham sweeps to deep square leg
lots of flight so Williamson comes down and drives to long-on. Good batting

what a shot. That is not easy, in face, the hardest shot today. Made that look incredibly easy. Flatter outside off, Latham skips down with nimble footwork and drives past cover, against the spin. Has almost always found the gap with his cover drive
dropped. A huge deflection, very hard chance. Short on off, Williamson goes back and cuts, but gets a thick edge. Spills out, hardly even a drop.
and then responds with that. Opens up his stance and then just lofts the ball over cover. Fantastic batting.
flat delivery outside off, Williamson gets across and sweeps towards backward square leg. Pandya prevents the boundary with a dive and saves a run
tossed up on off, Latham pushes this back. Good pace that
flatter on off, punched to midwicket from the back foot
a loose ball to begin with, so short that Williamson had plenty of time to go back and adjust to the low bounce before pulling for four
played into the leg side for a single

Latham's been given lbw, and it looks like the ball might have been missing leg stump! He went back to one angled into him from around the wicket and closed the face of the bat. The ball skidded on with the arm and hit the outside half of the front pad. That might have been clipping leg stump, at best
pushes forward tentatively at an offbreak from over the wicket and defends
comes out of his crease after pushing the ball back to the bowler and has to hurry back because Jadhav throws to the keeper
defended back towards the bowler
begins his new spell with a good length delivery just outside off, Williamson stays in his crease and defends
slants into the body of the right-hander this time, allowing Williamson to move across and whip the ball off his hips with the angle, hits it behind square
strays on to the pads to a greater degree this time, Taylor picks up his first runs by leaning across on the front foot and glancing behind square
throws his hands a bit too hard while playing the cut and bottom edges into the ground and to the keeper as a result, the ball was outside off this time and wide enough to cut
gets forward this time and defends with a straight bat
pitches on a good length outside off and angles into the right-hander, Taylor stays in his crease and dabs the ball to point
dropped short and Williamson picks up a single via a pull to deep midwicket
Axar Patel gives the ball a bit of air outside off, drawing the drive from Taylor towards cover point
driven through covers once again for a single
gets on to the front foot and gets low to defend a flatter wicket-to-wicket delivery
stays in his crease and pushes a flat delivery into the off side
played back to the bowler on the front foot

Williamson's been floored by a yorker that spears into him from over the wicket, it moved a fair distance before crashing into his pad after he missed the flick. Bumrah appeals for lbw but that's missing leg stump
follows up with a bouncer outside off stump, Williamson begins to play but stops the shot and lets the ball pass
good length and straighter, Williamson gets behind the line and blocks
driven on the front foot to cover and Williamson calls Taylor through, it's a risky single but Kohli misses the stumps at the bowler's end, would have been really close had he hit
Taylor stays really still in his crease and brings his bat down seemingly late to defend a fullish delivery
fast and just outside off stump, too close to the body to cut and Taylor is beaten as he swishes
dragged short once again, Williamson pulls along the ground to deep square leg
played back to the bowler
steps out of his crease and then defends back to the bowler, he wasn't to the pitch of the ball
stays back and punches through the line of a ball angling into him from around the wicket, hits the ball between the bowler and midwicket
defended back to the bowler off the back foot
lunges forward and outside off stump to get down on one knee and sweep the ball towards long leg
pitches on a good length outside off stump and jags into the right-hander, Taylor meets it with a small stride forward and defends on the off side

the lull in scoring has brought out the swipe from Taylor, he had to do something because New Zealand were stagnating. Taylor walked forward and towards the off side to drag the ball from outside off through wide mid-on for a boundary, not convincing at all

Taylor moves towards the off side in his crease, which means he is way too close to the delivery as it moves into him from short of a length outside off, he bottom edges the cut into the ground near his feet
played into the off side, another dot ball
that looked like a slower one and the line was leg side, the length on the shorter side. Taylor swivelled too early and made poor contact while trying to swat behind square
moves across his crease and plays to midwicket
cut off the back foot through point
driven to long off for a single
Williamson moves back and across and hits the ball to long-on with a straight bat
cut off the back foot again but no luck finding the gap in the infield at point
Williamson takes a single and then Taylor plays out a couple of dots and it's a good over for India - this ball is pushed into the covers
driven towards the bowler's left and Axar dives to prevent the single
Williamson moves inside the line to the bouncer and hooks, he doesn't middle it but the ball flies off the top edge and goes fine enough to beat the fielder at long leg
dabbed from the crease with soft hands, opening the face to play the ball towards point
half an appeal for lbw but that was missing leg, Taylor moved a long way across on the front foot to flick but missed, that was slightly slower
Taylor dabs the ball towards backward point and wants one, Williamson sends him back and he has to hurry, Rahane hits the stumps direct but Taylor is safe
good length on a wicket to wicket line, played off the front foot towards mid-on
moves forward and a little across before closing the face and playing towards square leg
played off the pads towards midwicket, that was the legbreak
tries to sweep but the length is a bit full, gets a bottom edge that drags the ball towards square leg
Taylor plays for the turn on the front foot but the ball goes straight on and hits the pad
driven to long off on the front foot for a single
comes forward and then goes back because the length is shorter and taps the ball towards long-on for a single
a fuller ball on off stump, Taylor drives smoothly to long-off for one more

good length angling into the batsman, Taylor pushes in the direction of the non-striker, Pandya leaps across the pitch to try and field but misses the ball, Williamson then runs and Pandey swoops on the ball and shies at the bowler's end, he misses the stumps though but he harried the batsmen
played to gully for a single
a slower ball on a length that isn't full, Taylor mis-times the swipe across the line and hits it towards deep square leg
moves his front foot well outside off stump and tries to swat into the leg side, he misses and is hit on the pad by a fuller ball

bowled full and wide outside off stump and that's possibly the first perfectly-timed shot from Taylor, he pressed forward and then waited on the ball before opening the face of the bat and steering through point
played off the pads behind square leg for a single

tossed up rather wide outside off stump, but Taylor had moved towards the off side before Mishra delivered so the umpire doesn't call it wide despite the batsman not making contact with his swipe towards the leg side
Taylor tries to hit across the line again from wide outside off but misses
this time the line is not as wide outside off and Taylor drills the drive towards wide long-on
defended on the front foot, straighter line to Williamson
dabbed with soft hands off the pads towards midwicket for a sharp single

caught on the slog-swipe at deep midwicket. Taylor has fallen to the plan. Mishra bowled the ball faster and outside off stump, Taylor met it with a lunge on the front foot and dragged it from outside off, he hit it quite a long way but not long enough to clear Rohit Sharma on the edge of the boundary
a fuller ball on the pads, clipped behind square for a single
good length outside off, Anderson stays back, covers the off stump and shoulders arms
good length outside off again, once again Anderson lets the ball go through to Dhoni
this time he has a little poke at a good length ball outside off before checking his shot, the ball whizzes past the outside edge
defended off the back foot with an angled bat towards point, Rahane rushes in to prevent the single
tight lengths from Yadav just outside off stump, Anderson thrusts his pad forward and shoulders arms
not for much longer, the ball is innocuous and on the pads, Williamson goes back and hits it through square leg
tossed up outside off from around the wicket, Anderson drives on the front foot and plays towards the covers
goes back and clips the ball off the pads into the leg side

goes back to one that is not that short and it keeps a bit low too, that skidded on with the arm instead of turning away from the left-hander from around the wicket, Anderson had to hurry and get some bat on it
played to deep backward square for a single
goes back and cuts the shorter and slightly wider ball towards deep point
Anderson moves towards the off side in his crease and offers a straight bat to push the ball towards cover
good length outside off, a punchy drive on the up to mid-on, straight to the fielder though
stays in his crease and angles the ball to push into the covers
short of a length angling into the left-hand batsman from around the wicket, Anderson stays back and blocks
once again Anderson is kept on strike by the short of a length ball that angles into him, Anderson closes the face and dabs into the leg side but the fielder at midwicket is quick to get to the ball

spoons the drive in the air but just wide of the fielder at mid-off, Kohli was the fielder and the ball was a little too far to his right. There was a man at cover too to Anderson split the gap. Kohli could have dived though, perhaps he didn't pick up the ball early enough
and Mishra delivers a full ball outside leg stump, which Williamson sweeps to the backward square leg boundary for consecutive boundaries for New Zealand
a full toss this time, which Williamson swats through square leg to move to 97
bowled flat on a wicket to wicket line, Anderson stays in his crease and defends on the leg side
played to backward square leg for a single
played into the covers
pushed to long-on for a single, Williamson keeps strike on 98
a length ball angling into the right-hander, Williamson stays in his crease and plays towards midwicket
moves forward and across to flick a length ball off his pads behind square, on to 99
Anderson pushes towards midwicket to give his captain the strike
a full ball angling into Williamson, he flicks but can't find the gap at midwicket
that's a full toss outside off and Williamson misses out by punching it to the man at cover, still has some issues with his hand

that's the first hundred by a New Zealand batsman on this tour, and the eighth ODI one for Williamson. He gets there with a graceful cover drive on the front foot, striding forward, head still and cover the ball as he laces it along the ground. Muted celebrations, as is usual for Williamson.

a bit of a slog, not very pretty, but Anderson finds the boundary. He lunges forward and drags the ball from outside off and thumps it to the cow-corner boundary. Mishra was bowling from around the wicket so Anderson was hitting with the angle into him
played off the pads behind square for a single
punched off the back foot towards long on for a single
played into the leg side for a single
nudged off the pads towards midwicket for a single
bowled flat and short outside off, cut off the back foot through point
short of a length angling into the right-hander, nudged off the back foot towards midwicket
up and over, Williamson gets under a length ball and lofts through the line, clearing the fielder at mid-on. He didn't smash it, but hit it well enough
played with an open face off the back foot on the off side
the slower ball, looked like a cutter because it moved into Williamson as he moved across his crease to flick and missed, he was hit on the pad outside the line of off
defended on the off side from the crease
nudged off the back foot into the leg side for a single
walks right across and works a full, straight delivery to deep square leg
good slower ball on middle and leg, Anderson can only play the ball back
nice, bottom-handed whip to wide mid-on. Overpitched, maybe looking for the yorker, and Anderson flicks with immense power. A parry from mid-on, diving to his left.
another slower ball on off, played away into the off side
another nice slower delivery on middle and leg, looked to go over midwicket but had to check his flick towards square leg
low full toss outside off, Anderson looked to hammer that away but all he could do was hit that to cover
full on off, a hint of inward tail. Worked towards midwicket, Rahane stops the run with a good dive
moves way down leg to open up the leg side, but Umesh follows him and Williamson taps towards cover
rolled his fingers on that, an offcutter at 126 kph on off. Glided towards point

excellent stuff. Firstly, the ball was pretty tight - around off on a  good length. Secondly, the batsman walks across and works a good ball wide of midwicket. Then, Rahane dives to his right to prevent the ball from going through
good length on middle, worked towards midwicket
full outside off, Anderson comes down and looks to swipe the ball over midwicket, but can only mis-time his heave to mid-on

massive appeal, umpire Chaudhary says no. Tossed up outside off, Anderson gets across and misses his sweep. gets struck on the pad. My first thought was slightly outside the line, but that was in line. Out! Missed that
steered towards third man. Flatter and wider
another quick-ish delivery on middle and off, driven to long-on
Williamson rushes to the ball and hammers his straight drive to long-on

given this time, may have been the seam-up delivery. Full and straight on off and middle, Anderson looked to work that ball into the leg side. Did he hit that off the face? There was definitely two pads on that. Straight and umpire Chaudhary gives him this time. Was plumb if there was no bat. A 102 kph quicker delivery from Mishra.
well bowled, slower and wide outside off, a bit of spin. Skewed to short third man. Bumrah fires a throw to Dhoni who deflects the bad throw onto the stumps, through his legs
flat on off, Ronchi goes deep in his crease and cuts to deep point
slowed up on middle and leg, worked away towards deep midwicket for a run
another short, flat delivery on off. Ronchi goes back and flat-bats his punch to cover
fired in, flat on off. Blocked
lots of flight on that, on middle and leg. Worked to deep midwicket
good shot. Runs to the pitch of the flight and drives the ball back, over the bowler for a run to long-off
excellent bowling, an ideal length. Williamson comes down but doesn't get to the pitch because it is slightly short. Worked towards midwicket, in the gap, for a couple
bad ball. Flat down leg, Williamson gets down and sweeps to deep backward square leg
the googly outside off, drilled to long-on

taken! Beautiful bowling, beautiful shot. Lovely catch. Again, Mishra shortens the length and ensures Williamson doesn't get to the pitch of the ball as he shimmies down. Despite not getting there, Williamson lofts his drive straight. Full face of the bat. Would have got enough on that had he got closer to the ball, but didn't as Rahane gets across from his right at long-on to take a good catch near the boundary. End of a really  tunning innings
flat on off and middle, defended
slower on middle and leg, a tad too short and Ronchi flicks nicely through midwicket. Nice placement
flight outside off, slowed up too. Driven elegantly to deep cover
flat on off, driven to cover.

and gone! NZ struggling. Short and wide outside off, a bad ball in all fairness. Ronchi goes back and gets a thick outside edge to Dhoni who takes a good catch. Dhoni's right leg went up in instinct. A poor shot from Ronchi, didn't account for the bounce or played under that. NZ in trouble now
shortish and wide outside off, steered towards deep point
tossed up on off, a bit of spin. Driven back
plays for spin, nothing there. Full and wide outside off, Santner misses his slash. Dhoni whips off the bails
looked like another seam-up delivery, flat, quick and wide outside off. Devich toe-ends his reverse sweep to deep point
lovely bowling, a loopy googly outside off. Santner drives to cover
flat and wide outside off, the ball turning back in. Cut to deep point
another quick, flat delivery on leg, nudged towards deep midwicket. Devcich makes the second with a dive, good running
the straight googly on middle, swept away awkwardly to deep square leg. Devcich labours back, maybe struggling with his hamstring, and makes it. Plonks his bat in.
another googly outside off, gives himself room and lofts the ball to long-off. Wanted to hit that more over cover.

a one-handed screamer from Axar. Not a great catch just because it was with one hand. A slower ball from Bumrah, Devich gets across and paddles him over short fine leg. or that's what it looks like. Axar keeps his eyes on the ball even as the ball seems to evade him, but he stick out his right hand (his non-dominant) and clings on. NZ sink deeper
another ripping offcutter outside off, pitches on off and spins away to beat the bat
low full toss outside off, hammered to deep cover
superb yorker. 135 kph, goes through Southee completely and somehow misses leg stump. may have even clipped the bottom of Southee's back boot

and gets him this time with an even better yorker. The first one was slightly leg side-ish, but he adjusts the line this time. More towards off stump, goes under Southee's bat and pegs back the off stump. A fantastic display of end-overs bowling, especially to new batsmen.
ooh, another one. Henry was probably anticipating that. Inch-perfect yorker. Kept out
a nice offcutter on off, scythed to point, another dot. Building up
good length outside off, pushed to cover and sets off. Axar side-arms a throw to the non-strikers end but Santner was safe
back of a length on off and middle, blocked towards cover
another hard length - shortish on middle. 147 kph. Mis-hit pull to square leg
slower ball on middle, swatted away to long-on
good length on middle, flat-batted to long-on, on the bounce
another slower delivery outside off which beats the bat of Henry. Dot
another offcutter outside off, smashed for four Pandey puts in a boundary-saving dive to save three. What a stop, sprawled across to his right
pushed towards mid-off for a quick run
another full delivery, looking for the yorker. Misses his mark. Henry hits to mid-off and gets one
another slower ball on middle and leg, Santner comes down and tries to hit this straight but gets a thick outside edge to third man
goes through again. Another yorker that slides down leg, between bat and pad. Incredible bowling
swatted down to long-off. Good length outside off, whacked but just one
a low full toss on leg, heaved to deep midwicket. Just one more
overpitched outside off, Santner backs away and drills his drive to long-off. Just another single
back of a length on middle, top-edged towards midwicket. Plonks for one. Not close.
another slower ball outside off, some extra bounce that takes the ball over Santner's cut. Another dot.
below the bat this time. Another short and wide delivery outside off, Santner tries to cut again, but the ball goes underneath. Variable bounce
another yorker on middle and leg, jammed out. Nothing Henry can do

slower ball and goes through Henry. Way too early into his heave. A yorker and a slower ball does for Henry, the yorker equally responsible for this wicket. Henry swings across the line, misses and the off stump is pegged back again
full outside off, a lovely Test-match length. Boult plays inside the line, gets a thick outside edge to Dhoni, which lands just in front
a low full toss on middle, thrashed back. Bumrah sticks out his right hand and stops the run
four after quite a while. Overpitched outside off, yorker. Boult gets a thick toe-end which races away to the third man boundary
a slower ball to finish, outside off. Hit to cover for a quick single.

inn2.comm: nice start. Good length on off and middle, no movement. Solidly kept out.
close to off, no movement for Henry but his channel is pretty good. Rohit offers the full face to block
a bit of width, a bit of swing. Short and wide outside off, slashed away behind point for a couple
lovely channel. A hint of inward movement at 138 kph, defended
good length on off, lovely start this. Rahane's natural instinct is to defend a good ball, like most good batsmen. That's all he can do
slightly too straight and Rahane whips him down to fine leg
a typical start from Boult. A gentle inswinger onto the pads, aiming for those stumps. Worked to midwicket
lovely start from NZ's seamers thus far. Good length on off, at 131 kph. Blocked
full and straight, 132 kph, worked to square leg
wow, superb shot. Slightly full on middle and leg, Rahane opens the face and plays it discernibly early to hit that gap through mid-off instead of mid-on. A lot of thought into the stroke
good length outside off, scythed to point
137 kph, fullish length on off. Blocked. Head over the ball.

137 kph, good length outside off, mis-timed slightly to cover. A nice punch. If he was past fifty, that would have raced through the infield. Just early in his innings for placement and timing to be spot on
nice and full on off, inviting some swing. There is none on offer, but the line is good. Defended
a lovely languid drive. Full and wide outside off, Rohit times his drive bit fails to find the gap, extra cover field
good length outside off, dabbed down to a well-positioned gully
another good length delivery outside off, hit towards cover. Five dots
full and wide outside off, a hint of width and so Rohit slashes at that but gets a thick inside edge, just past the stumps. This pitch will be slow, and cross-batted shots ain't going to be easy
quite close to off stump, no room. Rohit plays this towards point
pushed fuller outside off, hardly any swing by Boult's standards. Played to point from the front foot
knows he isn't getting much in the air, good length on off. Defended into the off side
another inside edge. 139 kph, full on off. A number of dot balls means Rohit tries to drive through the off side even though the ball isn't quite there. Onto the pad
good length on off and middle, pushed to mid-on
maiden. Good length on off, pushed to mid-off. A very good over, tight lines. Nothing offered to hit
and again. Fullish and wide outside off, Rahane tries to cut but the ball keeps a touch low. A thick inside edge just misses the stumps. Variable bounce and a slow surface.
straight, full. Tight. Driven to mid-on

that's how Rohit prefers to hit his boundaries. Nothing wrong with the delivery, full and straight - close to off. Rohit may have premeditated a full ball will go, gets one and lofts the ball over long-off with a clean swing, in one motion. Full face of the bat. Timing is good. Six.
nice and tight on middle, defended
a good change-up, 126 kph slower ball on middle and leg, worked into the leg side
shot. Great timing. Good length but a touch too wide, Rohit stays on the back foot and punches his drive on the up, past a diving cover and for four. Looks like pace off the ball the way to go
good length on off, no room. Defended
slower delivery and very wide outside off, 107 kph. Looked like a wide, but umpire Chaudhary doesn't call it. A smile on Boult's face
fullish outside off, Rahane tries to open the face and get one to third man but picks out Guptill at backward point
nice change-up that. A well-directed bouncer has Rahane in all sorts. Took his eyes off the ball, hung his bat up. The ball evades em all.
full on off, defended back.
his second successive maiden. Good length on off, defended back. Boult has been really good.
gentle start, 128 kph. But gets a bit of movement. Full on a fourth-stump line, nudged to point
a tad too straight on middle and leg, nudged past short fine leg for a couple.
good length on off, from the crease Rohit punches to mid-on
full on off, 137 kph. Nothing Rohit can do but defend or loft the ball over long-off with a full face. He chooses the former.
slower ball on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket. That's the way forward for NZ
135 kph, good length on middle and leg, worked away to deep square leg

taken. A thick outside edge is taken by Ronchi. Back of a length outside off, Rohit tries to force his drive through the off side but the ball may have seamed away just a tad and took the edge. Rohit immediately clutches his bicep, writhing in pain as the physio comes out to take a look at him. Not sure what he has done. Did try to punch the ball, immediate pain after the stroke. Boult, though, is pumped with the wicket. A reward for some very tight bowling.
works a length delivery towards backward square leg.
good length delivery outside off, cut to point
full and wide outside off, 138 kph. Pats it back. Looked to go square. This surface is definitely not the easiest to bat on
good length on off, played towards point
back of a length on off, nothing to work with. Rahane shuffles across and nudged down to short fine leg
full outside off, a hint of seam movement. Kohli strides forward and blocks
134 kph, good length outside off, steered down to third man. Opened the face late
fullish outside off, another neat dab to third man for one
nicely bowled, full, straight with some inward movement. Kohli flicks nicely to deep square leg
beautifully played. A slower delivery outside off, Rahane opens the face and plays it down through the vacant slip region. Third man had no chance
134 kph, fullish outside off, Rahane tries to work the ball into the leg side but fails to. Flicks into his pad
good length outside off, seams back in. Another open-faced dab to third man. A good run
a slower ball outside off, 129 kph. Rahane opens up the face and gets another run to third man.
good length outside off, 139 kph. Kohli plays away from his body and pushes this back
another slower ball, worked to short fine leg. Rahane wanted one, Kohli didn't. Rahane is sent back. Southee fires a throw to the non-strikers end but misses. Out with a direct hit.
good length outside off, mis-timed into the off side, clearly hard to score on. Not often Kohli struggles for timing
my bad. He has found it in a ball. Overpitched outside off, Kohli gets forward and send the ball whistling to the cover boundary with an exquisite drive. All along the ground
wide of the crease, 90 ks. Full, straight. Worked to midwicket
well down leg, skiddy stuff. But starts this too straight
gets drift in the air, moves back in. Yorker on off, jammed out
short and flat on middle, worked to deep midwicket, powerful flick
overpitched, yorker. Pushed down to long-on
a low full toss on off, pushed down to long-on. Easy. Absolutely no spin
great stop. Flat on off, a bit of drift. Kohli goes back and punches towards long-on but Devcich gets across to his right. Saves a run
slow on middle, but short. Rahane goes back and swats this to Williamson at midwicket who dives to his right to prevent the boundary
slowish again on middle, flicked powerfully to deep midwicket
gets some turn. Slowish on middle and leg, spins quite a bit. Since it is slow turn, Kohli can defend

gone. Kohli has been strangled down leg. Flat delivery down leg, Kohli flicks but gets just a thin edge which is wonderfully taken by Ronchi well down leg. Kohli has a smile on his face. Knew he hit that. Unfortunate way to go.
tossed up on off, defended. Nicely bowled
tossed up but short on leg, gets some spin which squares up Pandey. Worked to square leg for a quick single.
overpitched outside off, Pandey stretches out for it and flat-bats his drive to deep cover
nice, slowed up on middle and leg, worked to square leg
excessively quick on middle and leg, drift. Straight. Defended
round-arm action, flat on middle and leg. Nurdled to deep midwicket
an optimistic appeal. Flat down leg, goes down towards fine leg via the pad
driven into the leg side, another flat and quick delivery from Devcich. With no variation, Devcich will prove easy to face. Has to change it up
much better, flight on off, drift. Pushed to cover
nice and slow again, draws Pandey forward, defended
lovely. Drift, loop and flight. Gets Pandey forward, but pushed into the off side
more flight on middle, driven to long-off
84 kph, nice flight on off, blocked
flat on off, a bit of spin. Rahane waits for the ball to spin before working it towards square leg
seam-up, gets some swing. Full on off, worked to midwicket
another drift-y delivery, low full toss on middle. Lofted towards long-on. Cries of "catch", but Southee runs in from long-on, but can't get to the ball. Does well to save the boundary
a rank long-hop on middle and leg, Pandey goes back and swats the offering over midwicket. Easy
pushed to long-off
short and wide outside off, Rahane scythes his cut to deep point
drops short on off, Rahane comes down onto the front foot and punches to long on
premeditated shimmy down, but waited for the bowler to finish his delivery stride. Came down, yorked himself but jammed a drive to long-on
tossed up outside off, Rahane advances down and drives to long-off with the spin
more flight outside off, Pandey opens up his stance and guides the ball into the gap at deep point
flat on middle, a hint of spin. Worked to short fine leg.
nice end. Slows it up and finds the right area to bowl. Guided to point
good length outside off, 131 kph. Rahane taps the ball towards point.
what a shot. Full and wide outside off, Rahane stretches to the ball and thwacks the ball over the bowler. Wanted to hit that over the bowler and dragged the ball there. Four to long-off
yorker on middle, nudged to deep square leg
well bowled. 132 kph, full and straight. Pandey can only defend
a slower ball outside off is punched to mid-on
136 kph, good length outside off, Pandey stays slightly inside the line to open the gap and hit to deep point. Made room. A Warner-like stroke
sees Pandey coming, drops short and forces Pandey to improvise a defensive stroke
slowish and wide outside off, cut away to  point
88 ks, slow through the air on middle and off. Defended
great stop! Tossed up outside off, driven towards Guptill at cover who dives to his right o prevent the run
leading edge, very slow through the air, extracts some spin as a result. Goes towards point
good end. Flat and straight, blocked
good length outside off, Pandey opens the face and guides to third man
slower ball, pace off. Straight and full, worked to fine leg
another slower delivery on middle, nudged to the right of midwicket

he isn't sure. What an effort that is. Anderson gets low, and it looks like he has taken at first glance. Soft decision is out. Good change-up from Southee, a bouncer on middle. Rahane doesn't get on top of the bounce. Pulls to fine leg, where Anderson rushes in, stays low and takes the catch off the ground? Many replays. Did it land just in front of Anderson? Umpire Shamsuddin is the third umpire. He needs conclusive evidence that it has bounced to overturn this. Definitely bounced, but did it in his hands or on the turf. More and more replays. He doesn't have conclusive evidence to overturn his call. No doubt in my mind that it would have been not out had the soft decision been not out. Nonetheless, such is life, such is sport. Rahane has to walk back, India in a bit of trouble.
back of a length outside off, left alone
another short delivery and MS ducks underneath
flight outside off, no turn. Driven to cover, a good stop from Guptill

flat on middle, worked to deep square leg. Pandey looks for the second, hurtles back for it. Puts in a full-length dive. But that doesn't matter because he is more than a  few inches short. A fantastic throw from Santner, running around from a straight square leg, to the keeper. Ronchi comes in front of the stumps, collects the throw in front of him and he takes off the stumps in one motion. Was the run necessary? Pandey would have made the second against most teams. That was splendid from NZ. India in trouble now.
flat on middle blocked. Ronchi quite raucous now.
flat again on middle, Jadhav sweeps to short fine leg  Southee parries to deep square leg
full on middle, pushed to cover
overpitched outside off, drilled to cover
a full ball on the pads, clipped off the toes through square leg
short of a length outside off stump, Dhoni jumps back and gets squared up as he slugs the ball in the air between square leg and midwicket, that ball did not come on to the bat
good length just outside off, Jadhav stays in his crease and defends watchfully
good length on a slightly wider line outside off, Jadhav strides forward and shoulders arms
good length just outside off again, Jadhav defends back down the pitch, Southee being miserly with room at the moment
short of a length with width outside off, Jadhav cuts off the back foot but cant beat point
bowled flat into the right-hand batsman from around the wicket, hit off the back foot into the covers
played through the covers this time for a single

strays down leg side quite a long way, Jadhav reaches for it with the sweep and gets some bat on it, hitting it between the keeper's legs. Southee and Boult chase together, Southee dives and relays it to Boult and prevents the boundary
played towards square leg for a single

Dhoni was very far down the pitch when that ball struck him low on the front pad, so that can't be out lbw. Devcich appealed confidently though, after beating Dhoni in the air as he advanced and played across the line
pushed to long off for a single
short, too short and it doesn't rise either, Dhoni swivels on the back foot and pulls with a smooth roll of his wrists, hitting the ball along the ground with power
defended back to the bowler this time from the crease
throws his hands at a good length ball outside off without moving his feet, he was rooted to the crease as he inside edged that on the leg side
pushes forward at a fuller ball and opens the face late to steer the ball from just outside off to third man
opens the face and dabs the length ball, to third man once again
pushed towards mid-on, wont get the single
drifts on to middle and leg and Jadhav is quick to get down on one knee and sweep along the ground to the long leg boundary
bowled quick outside the off stump, Jadhav rushes through the shot and hits the ball to cover
dabbed off the pads towards square leg
bowled full on off stump, Dhoni comes forward and digs it out towards long off
bowled flat on a wicket to wicket line, nudged off the pads towards square leg
a full ball on middle stump, flicked through square leg for one more
short of a length outside off, Dhoni stays on the back foot and drives through cover, timed it well too
banged in short and Jadhav lets it go above his head
Jadhav begins to move towards the line of a short ball but then sways away, letting the ball whizz past his face
steered to third man for a single
opens the face and plays a good length ball towards point
played into the covers to finish the over, we're half-way through the chase. India now need 146 runs off 150 balls.
wicket to wicket line, flat trajectory, defended on the front foot
that might have pitched in the bowler's half of the pitch, it was so short and it sat up for Jadhav, who rocked back and pulled with might, smashing it over the midwicket boundary
nudged off the front foot towards the bowler
tossed up on middle and off, Jadhav takes a step out to get to the pitch of the ball and drives towards long off, Santner dives to his left but can't reach it
bowled flat with width outside off, too short as well, Dhoni waits on the back foot and cuts with those quick wrists, the man at deep point had no chance
I think he came forward and towards the off to try and dab the ball behind square but ended up bunting it towards mid-on
moves across in his crease to nudge a good length ball behind square for a single
Guptill dives full length to his right at point to save the ball with one hand, Dhoni had hit it quite crisply off the back foot
the slower ball bowled wide outside off stump, Dhoni lets it go through to Ronchi
good length angling into the right-hander from around the wicket, Dhoni stays on the crease and nudges into the leg side
nudged off the front foot into the off side for a single
short ball, seemed to come on to the batsman slower than Dhoni expected, he was through the pull shot rather early and was beaten
nudged off the pads towards square leg for a single

inside out over extra cover, Jadhav has painted a bullseye on Santner's back. He's skipped out of his crease and moved towards leg to make room, he then executed a flowing lofted drive despite not being fully to the pitch of the ball, clearing the extra cover boundary with ease
pushed to point for one this time, six and a single
played into the covers
played towards point off the front foot
too short and the line is poor too, down leg side, Jadhav pulls the ball behind square to bring up the 50 stand, I suspect that might be the last of Santner for a while
short of a length outside off, Dhoni stays back and cuts off the back foot, third man runs to his right to field
short of a length and down leg side, Jadhav tries to pull but is cramped for room, the ball bounced before reaching the keeper and the umpire thinks Jadhav has hit that with either glove or body
nudged gently into the empty space around the 30-yard circle at midwicket and they push hard for two runs before the fielder in the deep can get to it
dabbed off the back foot behind point for a single
stays in his crease and defends a short of a length ball into the covers
good length on a wicket to wicket line, Dhoni stays in his crease and defends on the leg side
a length ball outside off, the batsman opens the face late and steers the ball fine, third man has to race to his left and dive to save the boundary
banged in short outside off, Jadhav tries to ramp it over the keeper but he had to reach for it because of the springy bounce couldn't make contact
steered off the back foot towards third man
and leaking they are, Dhoni gets on to the back foot and pulls the short ball powerfully along the ground to the backward square leg boundary
short ball close to the body around off stump, Dhoni drops his wrists and lets the ball pass
stays back and pushes the good length ball towards point
played back to the bowler, think he wanted to hit it into the off side
short and outside off stump, Jadhav dabs it late towards short third man, Dhoni thunders through for a single
drifts into the pads, Dhoni moves forward and nudges towards square leg
a full ball on middle and leg, clipped off the toes through square leg
a full toss, Dhoni gently punches it to long-on for a single
stays back and waits for the ball on middle and leg before tucking it towards square leg

caught behind! Jadhav has steered the ball to the wicketkeeper. It was too full and a bit too close to him outside off to try and dab it to third man. Jadhav got down low to try and execute it, but the ball pitched just before and he couldn't control the bounce, a loopy catch for Ronchi
has he been having a net in the dressing room? That came right out of the middle of a straight drive on the up back to the bowler, Henry got a hand on it in his follow through
this time it's an inside edge though as Axar tries to force the good length ball through the leg side, the ball goes behind square
worked off the pads through square leg for a single
short of a length outside off, punched from the crease into the covers
short of a length around off, slanting across the left-hander from over the wicket, Axar stays back and opens the face to steer in front of point
bowled into the right-hander from around the wicket, defended on the front foot on the leg side
punched back to the bowler off the back foot
steps out and tries to dab the ball off the pads but misses
pushed in front of square leg, picking the ball off the pads
pulls the length back a touch as Axar presses forward and defends towards the bowler
Axar drives the ball gently to long on to keep the strike
a low full toss on the pads from around the wicket, Axar sweeps to deep square leg
Dhoni steps out and pushes the ball on the off side, gently
reaches for it on the front foot and drives, once he sees the ball beat Devcich's dive to his left, Dhoni strolls the single
Axar hits the ball towards long-on and they run the single once it passes the dive from the midwicket fielder
keeps a bit low on a wicket to wicket line, Dhoni was deep in his crease and dabbed with soft hands behind square leg
played back to the bowler, and the equation is a run a ball for the first time in the chase, the players will take a drinks break now
punched off the back foot into the covers, 96 off 95 now
skids through on Dhoni who has to rush through his shot to cover off the back foot
nudged off the front foot behind point for a single
pushed off the front foot back to the bowler, Santner went over the wicket to the left-hand batsman
drives the ball with the angle into him to long on, struck it well but only a single
bowled flat on a tight line on off stump, Santner has his groove back after Jadhav's wicket, Dhoni plays this one back to the bowler
worked off the pads on the front foot through midwicket to bring up the 150
a full one outside off, Dhoni lunges forward and drives to long-off
keeps a bit low in line with the stumps, pushed towards mid-on
whoops, Dhoni slogs off the front foot at one outside off stump, it moves into him a touch and beats the inside edge of the bat
bowled wide outside leg stump, too far away for Dhoni to connect
a full toss on the pads, Dhoni taps it behind square and sets off, as Devcich hobbles back to the stumps, Dhoni sprints up and down for two runs
cut off the back foot behind point
played back to the bowler from deep in his crease
gets on the front foot and pushes towards long on
strays down leg side, Axar tries to sweep but can't connect
driven off the front foot to long on, the ball kicks up a trail of dew in its wake
tossed up outside off and suddenly it turns, beating the outside edge of Dhoni's drive as he lunged at it on the front foot
played into the covers off the front foot
defended back to the bowler on the front foot
a fullish ball from around the wicket, the pace on the slower side, Axar moves forward and plays it into the covers
angles into the hips and Axar clips it behind square with the angle
Ronchi moves quickly to his right and dives to intercept the ball after it came off Dhoni's toe end of the bat, he swiped at it off the back foot, reaching for the short of a length ball outside off
punched off the back foot into the covers
good length outside off, Dhoni walks into a drive towards cover where the fielder dives to his right and deflects the ball towards long off
played from the crease into the covers, the runs required now has a lead of ten over the balls remaining
Santner begins his final over with a slow, flighted delivery outside off and it turns away from the right-hander, Dhoni is lunging on the front foot and chips it into the covers, uppishly
comes down the pitch and nudges to midwicket and keeps on running
that shot made the sort of sound that tells you immediately that it's going far, far away. Axar wound up and swung so hard, clobbering the ball deep into the stands beyond deep midwicket
Santner scampers quickly to his left to intercept a push back down the pitch and save runs
swept towards long leg for a single
pushed tentatively back towards the bowler on the front foot
slants the ball from a good length into the left-hand batsman from around the wicket, worked off the pads towards square leg
short of a length from over the wicket, Dhoni reaches for the wide one outside off and clubs it through cover

that is a sensational catch, a little like how Shane Bond caught Cameron White in New Zealand many years ago! Dhoni pushed at the ball a bit too early and it came right back down the pitch, in the air but it was dying as it approached the bowler. Southee was moving towards his left in the follow through but he stopped and dived to his right to scoop the ball with one hand inches before it was going to bounce. So Dhoni will not take this game deep, someone else has to try and finish it for India. New Zealand edge ahead in this tense chase.
played off the hips towards long leg for a single
defended from the crease towards the off side

what timing from the new batsman, Pandya moves forward and drives the length ball smoothly between cover and mid-off, the fielder dives to his left but the ball just beats him and races to the boundary
drifts down leg side with his first ball, a wide is called
another one down the leg side, another wide

would you believe it, Axar has mowed a full toss towards long-on, where Santner runs in from the boundary and dives forward to catch it inches from the turf. That was such a loose ball but Axar wasn't entirely balanced as he hit that, perhaps he tried to smash it too hard
a third wide down the leg side
played to long on for a single
pushed with soft hands close on the off side for a single and Pandya hurries Mishra through for a quick single
leans forward and across to work the ball towards midwicket

Guptill has two in the over! Luck, or a masterstroke from Williamson? Mishra plonks his front foot down the pitch and mows across the line, the ball flies towards short fine leg off the top edge and Bracewell runs backwards to settle under the catch. This chase has unravelled quickly with India a long way from the target
and that's the fourth wide of the over, wide down leg side. Two wickets in an over of predominantly rubbish!
defended on the back foot towards the bowler
good length angling into the right-hand batsman, played with the angle through midwicket
a fuller length on a wicket to wicket line, the batsman moves forward and defends with a straight bat towards the bowler
short of a length around the off stump line, defended back to the bowler
stays back and opens the face of the ball to play towards point
short of a length angling into off stump, Yadav gets behind the line and defend son the off side
Boult continues to have a terrific night, rapping the pads with a full delivery to finish an over in which he conceded only one run
short of a length and wicket to wicket, Pandya stays back and works the ball on the leg side
pushed with soft hands through square leg and they rush through for two before the deep fielder can get to the ball
cuts hard at the ball and gets a bottom edge that thuds into his shoe, could have easily gone on to his stumps
played into the covers for a single
there's a direct hit at the bowler's end but I think Yadav is safe. He pushed the ball towards midwicket and ran without hesitation and got in quite comfortably in the end

the field comes in to try and keep Yadav on strike and Pandya  responds by cutting hard, slashing the ball over point. Bracewell pulls off a stupendous save on the boundary, racing along the boundary to his left and diving and tumbling while desperately trying to pull the ball in. He's just touched the boundary though, grazed it, and that will be a four

Pandya would have been out had there been a direct hit at the bowler's end, Yadav had dabbed the ball to midwicket and Pandya wanted to get on strike and so he ran, Yadav sent him back because the fielder had got to the ball quickly
short ball, Yadav hooks, gets a top edge that falls safely behind square
pushed into the covers, no room to work with around off stump
moves across his stumps to flick but gets hit on the pad by a good length ball that slants towards the leg side
looked like a slower one outside off, Pandya made room to drive through the off side but was through the shot too early
moves across in his crease and clips a length ball off the pads through midwicket for a single to keep the strike
good length and dead straight, Pandya backs away towards the leg side and swats the ball with a flat bat towards mid-off, he hit that off a middle-stump line

Pandya swings hard and across the line, mis-timing the ball towards midwicket off the toe of the bat, Pandya urges Yadav back for the second and had the stumps been broken at the bowler's end, Yadav's dive would not have saved him
short of a length and Pandya mis-times another slog between midwicket and mid-on
a cracking pull from Yadav, dismissing a short ball that just sat up to the midwicket boundary to take India past 200
another short ball, seemed to be a bit slower and Yadav wound up and pulled behind square, did not make as great contact this time
nudged off the pads through midwicket for a single to finish the over, Pandya keeps the strike
slapped off the back foot after making room by moving towards leg, cant beat the infield at cover
short of a length and skiddy outside off, around 140kph, Yadav swishes and misses
dabbed off the back foot behind point and Pandya is off in a flash to take the strike
Boult has a wry smile on his face after that ball jagged into the right-hander, beat the attempt to force into the leg side, thudded into the thigh pad and ran to the third man boundary
he cuts and the man at backward point can't stop it while diving to his left, there's a fumble in the deep too
driven to mid off for a single, Pandya keeps the strike again, this is getting tenser. Boult has had an expensive over, his first of the night. Though four were leg byes
a length ball outside off stump, Pandya moves forward and towards the off side and flicks it towards wide long-on, they race back for the second, the crowd cheers as India close the gap
stays back this time and works the length ball through midwicket, not in the gap in the deep so just the single
Southee loses his line, strays down leg side and concedes a wide, 26 needed off 22 now
New Zealand are not bowling full at these batsmen, it's short of a length and slower this time, Yadav backs away and tries to play on the off side, the ball bounces over the top of the stumps
Southee's lucky there, it was far too short and Yadav pulled it so powerfully, he placed it right to Taylor at square leg, a few feet on either side and that was four

short of a length again, swatted to mid-off and a quick single results in a direct-hit at the bowler's end ricocheting towards cover for an overthrow, Williamson was the thrower and Latham fumbled collecting the ricochet at cover
moves back and across to flick the short of a length ball through midwicket
short of a length once again, swatted through midwicket for a single
length ball outside off, length again, on repeat. Yadav stays beside the line of the ball and cuts hard, beating backward point. Southee runs to his right from third man and dives to save two runs
short of a length again, on the pads this time, Yadav moves across and flicks behind square
finally a full ball, swinging and nearly a yorker, but Pandya is good enough to drill it out through midwicket, I wonder how Umesh might handle one of those?
back of a length again to the No. 10, Yadav plays it into the covers and sends Pandya back, he rushes back and dives to make his ground, no direct hit though
a fuller length outside off, Yadav gets on the front foot and throws his bat into a drive, he gets an outside edge that runs down to third man
short of a length outside off and Yadav cuts, the ball races across the outfield to Bracewell to third man, there's some awkward bounce in the deep but he adjusts well to field it
a slower ball wide outside off stump, that is just on the guide line outside off as Pandya lets it go, not a wide
Pandya is playing a blinder here, clubbing another short of a length ball over the head of the fielder at mid-off, he got on the front foot, cleared the front leg to make room and then swung hard
in the blockhole this time, full balls have been such a rarity in the slog, Pandya digs it out towards the bowler

Pandya's fight has ended and silence blankets the Kotla. The short ball brings the wicket. Boult dug that in really short and Pandya met it way outside the crease, trying to slap it down the ground off the front foot and with a flat bat. He was in a really awkward position as he made contact and the top edge flew high in the air towards the fielder on the sweeper boundary. Santner judged the high-pressure catch well
a full toss outside off stump, Yadav plays towards point and runs the single to keep strike
Southee goes full, he swings it into the right-hander but Yadav is up to it, bringing his bat down and hitting the ball hard through midwicket
a full ball outside off, nearly blockhole length, Yadav reaches for it on the front foot and drives to long off, he won't get the second this time, Bumrah will have to face

Southee raises his arms in relief almost after delivering the perfect yorker to the No.11, returning the favour to Bumrah. The ball swings into the right-hander and dips under the bat to crash into middle stump, lighting up the bails to give New Zealand their first victory on what has been a tough tour of India. New Zealand level the series with a six-run victory.
